101.heading: Dutch East India Company.
101.title: "The Netherlands East Indies" p. 36-42 in True Comics, no. 16

History. k. Dutch people. k. 1566-1579 A.D. k. Spanish occupation. Call no.: PN6728.1.N4R4no.23

119.heading: Dutch Underground.

119.author: [No author]

120.title: Dutch Underground "We Are Alone, Gestapo Dog!"
120.author: by Milburn Rosser.
120.series: Race Riley and the Commandos, Nov. 19, 1942
notes: Summary: In an application of psychology, the Nazi is placed on a lit powder keg, with six minutes to tell the Dutch underground what they need to know.

121.author: by Capt
121.series: Suicide Smith and the Air Commandos

123.heading: "Dutchess of the Dirty Queen" (The Barflies) / Roy Carpenter.
123.title: p. 24-27 in Missoula Scandals
123.author: [No author]

124.heading: "The Dutchman."
124.title: "Ella" p. 57-76 in Joe's Bar
124.author: Muñoz, Sampayo ; translated by Jeff Lisle ; edited by Bernd Metz.
notes: Summary: Ella is a white woman who is a photographer, and a hypochondriac. She has an affair with a black doctor, who beforehand expresses his reservations by talking about Leroy Jones and "The Dutchman." He leaves her for another black man. Throughout the story Ella encounters and photographs people involved with their own stories in Joe's Bar, including Pepe the Architect and Moses Man.

125.title: "The Dutchman's Gold Mine"
125.author: art: George Appel? 6 p
notes: Introduction of a Dutchman; villains Kurt and other Nazis are introduced and die.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

127.heading: Dutchmen.
